abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
Learn about important changes to Core Location.
An interface for exposing a custom type or app-specific concept to system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
An interface to express that a custom type has a predefined, static set of valid values to display.
An interface for providing an app-specific capability that people invoke from system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
A set of optional methods that text view delegates can use to manage selection, set text attributes, work with the spell checker, and more.
A standard item that is configured to send -showWritingTools: to the firstResponder when invoked.
Add support for Writing Tools to your app’s text views.
A type you use to initiate searches from your interface and offer suggested text completions.
The configuration details to apply to a user query.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to exclude semantic-based search results from the output.
Enable Apple Intelligence to summarize and prioritize app content using Spotlight extensions.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Enabling Apple Intelligence summarization and prioritization

abstract.text: A protocol that describes how a type interacts with transport APIs such as drag and drop or copy and paste.
Generates images programmatically from the description and style information you specify.
Text elements that specify the content to include in the image.
Style options that determine the appearance of generated images.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A view that can display and edit long-form text.
A control that displays an editable text interface.
Specifies the Writing Tools behavior for text and text input in the environment.
A data object for an emoji-like image that can appear in attributed text.
A class that represents an email conversation.
A class that represents a message conversation.
A set of methods that defines features for keyboard input to a text object.
The writing tools experience to support in the current view.
The methods for receiving editing-related messages for text view objects.
Generate reply suggestions by using Apple Intelligence and put selected text into your text UI.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Adopting Smart Reply in your messaging or email app

abstract.text: Add support for Writing Tools to your app’s text views.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
The identifier of an app entity that you associate with the user activity.
